question: Will year-to-year inflation in the European Union be 5.2% or more in November?
description:
This is a market on a year-to-year inflation, as measured by the Eurostat (HICP), from November 2020 to November 2021.

This market will resolve to “Yes” if the European Union annual inflation in November 2021 is 5.2 percent or more and "No" otherwise.

The resolution source for this market will be the Eurostat, the statistical office of the European Union: https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/products-euro-indicators.

The next release of HICP inflation rate with full data for November 2021 is scheduled for 17 December 2021.

-----------------------------------

Note, that this market is about the inflation for all European Union Member States, not only the Euro zone (states using €).

Inflation dashboard for the Euro zone can be viewed here: https://www.ecb.europa.eu/stats/macroeconomic_and_sectoral/hicp/html/index.en.html

question: Which cryptocurrency will perform better in December 2021: Bitcoin or Ethereum?
description:
This is the market on the relative change (%) of the USD prices of Bitcoin and Ethereum in the month of December 2021.

The change of prices will be calculated by dividing the price dated 1 January 2022 (ET) by the price dated 1 December 2021, ie:

ΔB =  [BTC/USD price on January 1, 2022] /  [BTC/USD price on December 1, 2021]

ΔE =  [ETH/USD price on January 1, 2022]  / [ETH/USD price on December 1, 2021]
 
If, after the resolution time (January 1st, 2022), ΔB is greater than ΔE, this market will resolve to "Bitcoin".

If, after the resolution time (January 1st, 2022), ΔE is greater than ΔB, this market will resolve to "Ethereum".

If they are exactly equal then the market will resolve 50/50.

----------------------
To resolve the market, Coingecko's historical daily prices will be used and can be seen under "Historical Data" tab on the following sites:
https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/bitcoin/historical_data/usd#panel
https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/ethereum/historical_data/usd#panel )

This market will resolve on the December 31 2021 Close price, which will be the same as January 1 2022 Open price. 

Note also, that the daily open price refers to 30-min candlestick open price at 12 AM in the UTC+0 Time Zone and is also used in the "1y" line chart view.
----------------------

The opening prices for December 1st were:
Bitcoin: $57,011
Ethereum: $4,637.12

question: Will Crypto.com's $CRO price be above $0.80 at noon on January 1, 2022?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Crypto.com Coin (CRO) has a candlestick closing price of $0.800001 or more, as per resolution source, on January 1, 2022, 12pm ET, and “No” otherwise. 

The resolution source for this market will be prices listed on CoinGecko (https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/crypto-com-coin). 

This market will resolve on the “C” (i.e. closing price) listed for the candle titled “Sat 1 January 2022, 12:00:00”, with the “Price” tab selected, in the Eastern Time Zone. Note, this 12:00:00 candle lists the opening price for 11:30:00 PM ET and the closing price for 12:00:00 PM ET. 

The check will be at 12:30 PM ET, on the resolution date. If the resolution source is unavailable at the resolution time, another credible source will be chosen.

question: NBA: Will the Bulls beat the Knicks by more than 2.5 points in their December 2 matchup?
description:
In the upcoming NBA game, scheduled for December 2:

If the Chicago Bulls win by over 2.5 points, the market will resolve to “Yes”.

If the New York Knicks lose by less than 2.5 points or win, the market will resolve “No.” 

If the game is not completed by December 9, 2021, the market will resolve 50-50.

question: Will Derek Carr have the most passing yards in the 2021 NFL season on December 25?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Las Vegas Raiders' player Derek Carr is the player with the most Passing Yards in the 2021 NFL season on the resolution time, December 25, 12PM ET.

The resolution source is the official statistics of National Football League (https://www.nfl.com/stats/player-stats/).

If the data is not available on the resolution time, another credible source will be used.

If Derek Carr ties with another player for most passing yards, this market will still resolve "Yes."

question: Will daily atmospheric CO2 be above 416 ppm on Christmas Eve?
description:
This is a market on whether atmospheric CO2 will be above 416.00 parts per million (ppm) for the date of December 24, 2021 as measured by the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration’s Mauna Loa observatory (https://www.esrl.noaa.gov/gmd/ccgg/trends/monthly.html). 

This market will resolve to “Yes” if the daily average atmospheric CO2 is greater than 416.00 ppm for December 24, 2021 and “No” otherwise. 

This market will resolve when data for the date of December 24, 2021 is first published on the resolution source, i.e. in the green information box on https://www.esrl.noaa.gov/gmd/ccgg/trends/monthly.html, which appears under the “Recent Daily Average Mauna Loa CO2” heading. 

If data is not available for the date of December 24, 2021, by December 31, 2021, 12:00 PM ET, this market will resolve 50-50.

---------------------

Warning: It may be possible to infer Daily CO2 emissions using data available elsewhere on the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration’s Mauna Loa observatory website (here: https://gml.noaa.gov/dv/data/ & https://gml.noaa.gov/dv/iadv/) up to 24 hours before they are published to the main resolution source. Trade at your own risk within the last 24 hours of the market.

Trade at your own risk within the last 24 hours of the market.

question: Who will win the primaries of Les Républicains in France?
description:
This is a market on the winner of the 2021 Congress of Republicans, also known as the Congress for France. It is an organized internal primary of the French major political party, Les Républicains (LR), in order to nominate a candidate representing this party in the French presidential election of 2022. 

The Congress takes place from December 1 to December 4, 2021. The results of the first round of voting were announced on December 2 2021. A run-off will be held between Éric Ciotti and Valérie Pécresse on December 3 2021, with the result expected the day after.

If Valérie Pécresse is announced winner of the primaries, this market will resolve to "Pécresse".

If Éric Ciotti is announced winner of the primaries, this market will resolve to "Ciotti"

If by December 25, 5PM ET, Les Républicains for any reason has not announced the winner of the primaries or will appoint another candidate for the presidential election, this market will resolve 50-50.

The source used to resolve the market will be the official website of Les Républicains political party, https://republicains.fr/. Credible news reports will also be sufficient.

question: Will 248 million Americans have received at least one dose of an approved Covid-19 vaccination by January 1, 2022?
description:
This is a market on whether 248.0 million people in The United States of America will have initiated vaccination, according to the CDC COVID tracker, by the resolution date, January 1, 2022, 8:00 PM ET. 

This market will resolve to "Yes" if 248.0 million people or more are listed as having received their initial dose of vaccination by the resolution source. This only concerns the first dose of vaccination. For vaccines requiring two doses for inoculation, this market considers only the first dose as having initiated vaccination. 
This market will resolve to "No" if, for any reason, fewer than 248.0 million people have initiated vaccination by the resolution date. 

The resolution source for this market will be the official data published by the CDC available at https://covid.cdc.gov/covid-data-tracker/#vaccinations, and will be checked at the resolution time. 

If the website is down, the most recently available data will be used to resolve the market. If the website is not down, this market will resolve according to the data as available immediately at the time of resolution, and resolution will not be delayed for the purpose of waiting for updated data from a specific date.
